txt.en: Talk to Derwent Bindweed in Stoneheight
'I know who wrote this note, [placeholder]!'
'Which one of you is from Bree?'
'Must be you, then. Get him, boys!'
Talk to Derwent Bindweed in Stoneheight
Derwent is pleased to show you around his new home, the town of Stoneheight.
Walk with Derwent Bindweed through the town of Stoneheight
Derwent doesn't understand why you think Stoneheight has a reputation for danger.
Something has happened that has not happened for eight days:\n\nOrcs have come to the town of Stoneheight!
'Welcome to Stoneheight, my friend! I will be happy to show you around.'
Derwent Bindweed is frightened, but otherwise unharmed.
Derwent Bindweed has made an unpleasant, if not especially surprising, discovery.

'Once again you have proven yourself a hardy friend to have, [placeholder]!\n\n'But what did that Orc mean when he asked which of us came from Bree? It sounded as if he was looking for someone in particular... but for what purpose?'
'It's Bill Ferny, it has to be! That villain! He directed these Orcs to come in search of me!\n\n'I am lucky you were here, [placeholder].'
Wait for Derwent to investigate
'Everyone at Stoneheight has a past, that's for sure; Derwent will fit right in! We'll help him as we can. It's just the neighbourly thing to do.'
'Once again you have proven yourself a hardy friend to have. We are lucky you were here!'
Derwent Bindweed has left one dangerous town behind, only to find another.
'Aye, Rose?'
'Not safe?'
'It's been eight days since the last Orc attack, hasn't it?'
'Now this is a proper Stoneheight welcome!'
'Let that be a lesson to you!'
'Must be talking about our new neighbour, Rose!'
'I really appreciate your help back in Bree, [placeholder].'
'What's that?'
'Why, this is just some rustic decor.'
'Nothing to worry about.'
'Really, [placeholder], have you never seen an idyllic country town before?'
'This?'
'Good mornin' to you, Derwent. How are you enjoying your new home?'
'Why, someone is simply taking apart this waggon for the wood.'
'Not safe? What a thing to say!'
'I could see some lovely flowerpots being made from these sidings.'
'Ned!'
'Even so, I am glad my family and I were able to find a new home.'
'This Brawler says the town isn't safe!'
'I think you might be a good luck charm for us, Derwent.'
'One whole week without Orcs at Stoneheight is quite a lucky span!'
'But now it's done. Here they come again!'
'Welcome to Stoneheight, Derwent!'
'Ha ha! That showed 'em!'
'Who knows what Bill Ferny might have gotten up to if we stayed in Bree?'
'Stoneheight just needs a little fixing-up, that's all. What town does not?'
'I'll show you there's nothing to worry about. Follow me!'
'Oy! Hullo there, Rose!'
'Quite a lot, thank you!'
'But my friend here says Stoneheight isn't safe! Can you believe that?'
'I moved in seven days ago and it seems perfectly safe.'
Neighbour Ned
'What's that? Eight... days...?'
'Who wants to... who wants to know?'
'A note! Listen to this!'
\qListen up, you lot.\q
\qYou didn't hear this from me, but I've got some easy pickings for you.\q
\qFellow from Bree has caused me some trouble in the past.\q
Instance: The Melee in the Square
Talk to Derwent Bindweed
\qHe fled to Stoneheight, a town not far from Orc Valley.\q
'Shush, Ned.'
Meet with some of Derwent's neighbours in Stoneheight
\qDo something about him and I'd appreciate it. I might have more tips for you.\q
Neighbour Rose
Protect Derwent and his neighbours from the Orcs
\qSigned, a Friend.\q
